prompt: The student conducting this experiment has a hypothesis that the plant receiving more light will grow more. The amount of light is the ![dropdown:one] variable and the growth of the plant is the ![dropdown:two] variable.
description: The illustration shows three growing plants, a light bulb shining above them, and a shade blocking some of the light. The plant on the left is completely in the light. The plant in the middle is halfway in the light. The plant on the right is completely shaded.
feedback: The student scientist is controlling the amount of light each plant receives and expects the growth of the plant to increase when the scientist gives it more light. Therefore, the amount of light is the independent variable. It is controlled by the scientist. The amount the plant grows is the dependent variable that will vary depending on how much light the plant receives.
